intro: Allophylus africanus f. senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese alder, is a shrub or small tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
